New Records: Manny Machado tied Nate Colbert's record for San Diego Padres' career home runs with 163
Key Match Events: Manny Machado hit two home runs, including a solo shot in the first and a drive into the second deck in left field leading off the eighth
Manny Machado added an RBI single in the fifth, bringing in Fernando Tatis Jr.
Giants RHP Mason Black allowed four runs and six hits in 4 2/3 innings
Padres RHP Michael King (12-8) held the Giants to one run and six hits in six innings
Post-Match Reflections: Manny Machado expressed pride and honor in tying the franchise record
Manager Mike Shildt called Machado's second shot 'a big boy home run' and said tying the franchise record is 'a big deal'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of a sellout crowd of 42,595
Manny Machado has 338 homers in his 13-year career
Manny Machado has 42 multi-homer games since his rookie year of 2012
Others: Jackson Merrill, the Padres' CF, left the game with a bruised left patella suffered on a foul ball in the sixth
The Padres are scheduled to start RHP Dylan Cease (12-10, 3.62) against the Giants' RHP Logan Webb (11-9, 3.43 ERA) on Saturday night
